intro: Silene graminifolia var. longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered lady's mantle, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate, hairy leaves. The plant produces tall, slender stems that bear clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers with five petals. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
